title: Do all plants produce some kind of fruit? If not, where does all the sugar that the photosynthesis creates go? - Quora

response.answer_text: It goes into building other parts of the plant and running the plant's metabolism. And anyway, the output of photosynthesis is not what makes fruit sweet. Photosynthesis produces glucose. The sweetness of fruit comes from other sugars like fructose.

Most of the sugar molecules produced by a plant are linked together in long chains to produce cellulose fibers. The plants use these fibers of cellulose as the primary building material for their bodies. Cellulose is what makes a plant strong enough and tough enough to stand itself up off the ground. Cellulose - Wikipedia
